intro: Exostema souzanum, commonly known as the rainbow plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that resemble flowers. The plant has palmate leaves with a velvety texture and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant foliage. The plant prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
